{
  "Allegations" : "CUSTOMER ALLEGES THAT THE NUMBER OF PREMIUMS REQUIRED TO MAINTAIN A MASS MUTUAL WHOLE LIFE INSURANCE POLICY(IES) WAS (WERE) MISREPRESENTED.",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",
  "arbitrationClaimFiledDetail" : "",
  "arbitrationDocketNumber" : "",
  "Broker Comment" : "AT THE TIME OF SALE, THE POLICY OWNER WAS GIVEN THE NECESSARY INFORMATION TO MAKE AN INFORMED DECISION. CONSEQUENTLY, IT APPEARS AS IF THERE IS NO BASIS TO SUPPORT THE ALLEGATION AGAINST ME. 07/27/2009 THIS SETTLEMENT WAS MADE BETWEEN MASSACHUSETTS MUTUAL LIFE INSURANCE COMPANY (\"MASSMUTUAL\") AND THE PLAINTIFF. IT INVOLVES THE APPLICATION OF THE PLAINTIFF'S DIVIDENDS TOWARD THE ANNUAL PREMIUM PAYMENTS ON THE WHOLE LIFE POLICIES. DURING ANY YEAR WHERE THESE DIVIDENDS ARE NOT SUFFICIENT TO COVER THE ANNUAL PREMIUMS IN FULL, MASSMUTUAL WILL PAY THE DIFFERENCE."
}
